newsitem.title: CANADA: North and Central America port conditions -Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: North and Central America port conditions -Lloyds.

text.p: CANADA, Jan 13 - Vancouver, BC - GRAIN - 3 Vessels loading, 18 waiting. Delays at present estimated at up to three weeks due to heavy snow in late December closing both the main railways for several days. 16 Vessels due by end-January. Roberts Bank - 1 Vessel loading, 13 due by end-January, 17 already nominated for February. Prince Rupert - GRAIN - 1 Vessel loading, 3 waiting, delays here estimated at 7-10 days depending on grade to be loaded. Montreal, QUE. - All terminals working normally, with no delays expected. Pilotage in the St. Lawrence river is in effect and night navigation is suspended for the winter.

HONDURAS, Jan 13 - Puerto Cortes - Four vessels berthed of which 2 discharging/loading containers/general cargo, 2 discharging wheat. 1 Vessel anchored, 1 in ballast. 13 Vessels due of which 5 to load/discharge containers/general cargo, 6 to load bananas, 2 to discharge (1 fuel oil, 1 wheat and soda). No berthing delays expected.

MEXICO, Jan 14 - All ports working normally. Altamira - Two vessels in port of which 1 machinery, 1 under repairs. Tampico - 11 Vessels in port of which 2 general cargo, 1 sugar, 2 minerals, 1 coke, 2 steel coils, 1 cement, 1 gasoline, 1 other vessel. Veracruz - Ten vessels in port of which 1 cars, 3 pipes, 2 general cargo, 2 sugar, 1 scrap, 1 under repairs. Manzanillo - 12 Vessels in port of which 3 general cargo, 1 cars, 1 clinker, 1 cement, 2 containers, 2 grain, 2 fruit. Coatzacoalcos - 14 Vessels in port of which 9 tankers, 5 chemicals.

PANAMA, Jan 13 - Balboa - Two bulkers, 1 chemical tanker, 1 container carrier in port. Cristobal - One general cargo, 1 general cargo/reefer, 1 part container carrier, 1 ro/ro vessel in port. Panama Canal - Transit booking system working normally at full capacity. 38 Vessels due, 31 in queue, 16 booked, 47 scheduled.
